website_summaries.verdict: We can’t justify the purchase of this machine when we compare it with the $169 Bunn My Cafe MCU, which can make decent K-Cup coffee and a reliable cup from fresh grounds.
pros: As K-Cup coffee goes, the sturdy Cuisinart SS-700 makes the best cup we tasted
cons: You can still make a quick, easy cup of coffee with other brewers in the same price range

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine, works wonderfully and it's a work-horse!
customer_reviews.text: I usually do not comment on my purchases (unless something extraordinary is observed), but after reading some of the reviews on this machine, I was hesitant to go ahead with it. I finally purchased it for our office (about 8 people), and after almost a month of use, I can safely say that this is a GREAT machine at an incredible price. It starts at 8:30 AM and runs non-stop until 5 to 5:30 pm every day! It does the job with no issues or difficulties. It easily outperforms the Keurig one I have at home. I am VERY happy with it and highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Kayvan

customer_reviews.title: , We had one of these for several years and liked it. It broke, replacement works great. LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Edited this to say that replacement of faulty machine was easy. New machine has been great. We had one of these for several years and liked it. It broke. We replaced it with a Keurig. Hated that for several reasons and decided to order a new Cuisinart. It arrived yesterday. I set it up. The water pump makes a noise that sounds terrible. I was expecting the thing to explode. I have to return it. So frustrated. Amazon makes getting it replaced so easy that I will keep going until I get a good one. It is way better than the Keurig.
customer_reviews.author: pam b

customer_reviews.title: Best K-Cup Coffee Maker out there (But now DISCONTINUED BY MANUFACTURER)
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this Coffee Maker since 2011, bought it from here at Amazon. On average, I would say I have used it everyday at least once. As of 03/03/2020, it still works as I just brewed a cup of coffee a few minutes before writing this review. TWO things I would recommend you do, is to replace the charcoal filters and do the vinegar wash once a year. Yeah, the review is LONG overdue !!
customer_reviews.author: Sayed I

customer_reviews.title: Item should last as long as the warranty,
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine 2 years ago. It has a 3 year warranty. I don’t remember if I registered it. It has been having problems the last two months. Not brewing the full amount, just dribbling out like it has a bad prostate. I think for the price of $185 it should last at least the warranted 3 years. I have a lot of of cuisinart products in my kitchen, this is the only item that I am disappointed in.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne Allen

customer_reviews.title: BIG disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I purchased in July 2016 after having the same unit work for over 4 years. This one started acting up about 3 weeks ago. Put pod in - press brew.... cue cricket. Nothing. Turn it on and off multiple times. Still nothing. Repeat turn on off a few more times and finally it will brew. Seems to me when you spend this much money it should last longer than 2 months. It's too late to return to seller so I will explore options with the manufacturer. This is my last K-cup brewer. Love the convenience but tired of spending so much money on something that doesn't last. It's back to "old fashioned" brewing for me.
customer_reviews.author: mas_il

customer_reviews.title: I have absolutely loved it. It has stopped work once on us
customer_reviews.text: We have only had this a few weeks but have ran numerous cups of coffee and cocoa through it. I have absolutely loved it. It has stopped work once on us. I did what another reviewer said to do and took it to the sink, turned it upside down and smacked the bottom. A huge gurgling air bubble came out. After that it has worked like a charm. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Makes good coffee and tea
customer_reviews.text: I bought this coffee maker because I wanted a machine that would make one cup of coffee at a time and would also make a cup of tea that didn't taste like coffee. On these two points this coffee maker scores high. It also lasted longer than my previous Keurig machine—2 1/2 years as apposed to 6 months. Still, is it too much to ask that a coffee maker last longer than 2 1/2 years?
customer_reviews.author: winethyme

customer_reviews.title: HUGE waste of $$$$$
customer_reviews.text: We didn't use this coffeemaker more than a month. We brew 2 cups of coffee a day, and an occasional cup of hot water for tea or cocoa. We only use store bought purified water. The machine completely stopped working for no apparent reason. While it worked, it was great! We loved how quick it was and how hot the water was. This was our 2nd machine just like this and we will never own one again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: When i bought this coffee pot it said keurig brewed on the unit Wrong, the coffee did not taste the same as my keurig. I should have returned it. By the way i saw this coffee maker at walmart last week - newer model and it does not say keurig brewed .anymore. If you want a keurig brewed cup of coffee buy a keurig or a breville coffeemaker
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought a Keurig and it is fantastic. Please don't waste your money on this
customer_reviews.text: I followed all the steps for setup, and the water poured back into the reservoir instead of out the coffee hole...I'm sure there is a name for that. I called Cuisinart for repair information and they told me to send it back. They were going to charge me 10$ each way for shipping. After reading reviews, I decided to just return it to Amazon. Too many problems with this thing. I bought a Keurig and it is fantastic. Please don't waste your money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and superior brewer
customer_reviews.text: Set up was fast and easy. Works beautifully - so convenient to brew a single cup so quickly. Have tried Keurig brand machines and find this one to brew a superior cup (although as a general statement pre-packaged K-cups are never as delicious as fresh ground, this is probably as good as it gets -- and, it does come with a reusable K-cup filter if you want to go that route). Really pleased with the purchase -- the refurbished machine arrived in great condition (it looks like new). So happy that I decided to save a little money and opt for it over a new machine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: "Certified" refurbished???  What does that even mean??
customer_reviews.text: I have this exact same machine at home. I love it and it has worked flawlessly. I was confident that this would be a great machine for my office. It was listed as a "certified" refurbish. Filled it with water, plugged that bod boy in. My cup started filling.... and filling....and filling. I grabbed a vase and started filling it. I unplugged the machine and waited 10 minutes to plug it back in. It started filling the vase right where it left off... I hadn't even turned it on. I wonder what qualified it to be "certified" refurbished? DId they even test it??
customer_reviews.author: Cowgirl O

customer_reviews.title: WHY, OH WHY WAS THIS POT DISCONTINUED????
customer_reviews.text: This was the very best coffee maker available! If you can find one, you won't ever be satisfied with another. The new pot Cuisinart is offering now cannot even compare to the quality of this model. I was fortunate to find this particular model SS-700 here on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: carlssister

customer_reviews.title: Good but only for a few years.
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice, easy to use, makes great coffee. Had it now for 3.5 years and the pump has pretty much gone out. Still pumps out the coffee but now instead of quick it is very slow and dribbles the last 1/2 of the coffee. Seems to take forever. Nobody makes products to last anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Williams

customer_reviews.title: 3 Years in and Office and Still Going
customer_reviews.text: 3 years later and this still works! We use this in our office where we would go through Keurigs on an annual basis. I bought this machine because of it's 3 year warranty. Occasionally the top clogs, but you just need to run a couple cups of water through and/or clear the top dispersing nozzle. That's a lot better than the machine just not working anymore, which is what the Keurigs do.
customer_reviews.author: Angi K

customer_reviews.title: ORDER ONE NOW!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my Keurig that has finally bit the dust. WOW!!! Why I didn't buy a Cuisinart before a Keurig is beyond me. Makes a piping hot cup of whatever in less than 60 seconds. My Keurig which is about 5 or so years old would take at least 5 minutes while humming and chugging to suck up and heat the water. I made sure to descale and clean the Keurig but the darn thing just wants to give out. I got this gem of a coffee maker Cuisinart for about $30 or $40 dollar cheaper here than with any other retailer. It's super stylish and makes your beverage fast and hot.
customer_reviews.author: mason2x

customer_reviews.title: Love IT 💝 Excellent product and extremely fast and quiet!!! 💝
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for myself and love it guys 💝!!! At 1st I gave a bad review because we lost power and I thought that it broke, but I actually forgot about the power button... Ugh...It's awesome and even my husband loves it because of the fast hot ♨ water dispenser for his tea!!! I love it because it's fast, but most importantly it's very quiet!!! 💝 Excellent service and fast shipping and packed very well also!!! And, the fact that I can use my own brand of coffee to switch it up is a major plus in my book guys 💝
customer_reviews.author: Susan Newton

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It does everything it says. Ice tea or coffee, hot tea, coffee, cider, chocolate. It is very strong coffee. I use a K-cup at least twice with 12 oz brew cycle. Just leave the cup in, open and shut head push brew again. Works good, and I have a couple cups of coffee. Make sure u use a big enough container. I use my two cup measuring cup (16oz). Ice tea is good this way also, then pour it over a tall glass of ice or brew it to a tall glass. I just don't like my drinks as strong as a k-cup brews it so have adapted and overcome!. But love it so far!
customer_reviews.author: Ginger

customer_reviews.title: Was a great coffee maker UNTIL
customer_reviews.text: This was our second one the first one stopped working after owning it for about 3 years 3 months so we purchased a new one from Amazon. It worked great for 3 years 7 months. Guess what? Their warranty runs out after 3 years. I called the company and was basically told Sorry about your bad luck. Should have called before warranty ran out. So if anyone has purchased this machine make sure to check your warranty and send it back to get a new one before your 3 years are up. Customer service was rude and no help at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Purchased a Keurig during the Summer 2015. Like it. Took it to my job. We needed it. So.... I was not looking forward to "paying" for it again. Did some research... I made the decision to purchase the Cuisinart SS-700 - LOVE IT! I love it makes a larger cup, Cuisinart's reputation speaks volumes with this appliance. It's stylish, user friendly, great cost/savings. I made the right choice. I purchased the silver model. One other thing, I like I can set the tempature of my beverage.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!  Easy to use!  Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome! Just as my friend said and some TV program she watched that suggested it. The problem is that I'm drinking too much of the fun drinks like hot chocolate and chai latte, rather than the healthier options of natural herbal teas. It's so easy and quick to use! Beware of other places that offer it at half the price. They are probably refurbished instead of new like this one. Better warranty too! Highly recommend. You can buy teas/drinks/coffees for it at Bed, Bath, and Beyond. They have quite a bit they carry in the store.
customer_reviews.author: C. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Worked until I moved to a house with GFCI outlets in kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Trips the breaker half the time and also takes out the fridge. Never had this happen at the last 2 places. Another reviewer stated: "As with the Keurigs, the solenoid has leaked onto the air pump motor, causing it to corrode and seize-up, creating a short circuit. A small drip, over an extended period of time, onto an electrical circuit is something to AVOID!"
customer_reviews.author: Grahaminator

customer_reviews.title: This is BY FAR my favorite K-Cup coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I bought this refurbished a few months ago and it still brews a hot cup of coffee in a jiffy. This is BY FAR my favorite K-Cup coffee maker. A+ beautiful design and blue back light is nice too. On the side it has a push in / out side of maker that holds your ground coffee container. The small square filters are quick and easy to change and not costly at all. I will never go back to any K-Cup coffee maker but this. Looks good on my counter, works great and my coffee is hot every time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this coffee maker.
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love this coffee maker. It looks sharp with the stainless steel front, and works perfectly thus far. Heats up quickly and gives us a great cup of coffee. The only thing I would note, which I didn't notice prior to purchasing, is that the whole thing isn't stainless steel. It's actually black along the top and back. It's not a problem for me, but I thought some people may want to know that. Update: We've had this coffee maker for a few months now and still loving it. And it makes the best Iced Coffee, love that option.
customer_reviews.author: JParker93

customer_reviews.title: Never worked right from the day we got it
customer_reviews.text: This machine never worked right from the day we got it. I made the mistake of trying all of the "fixes I read about to get this thing to work (none of them worked for long) and missed Amazon's 30 return policy. I ended up contacting Cuisinart for a replacement. When I gave them them serial number they informed me it had been manufactured in 2010!!! (this is 2016) Thank goodness they stand by their products and they are sending me a brand new one. We shall see...
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Martin

customer_reviews.title: perefect! no complaints at all.
customer_reviews.text: we have this model at work & it works wonderfully with tons of usage every day so i got one for at home. i luv it. it takes a couple minutes to warm up when first turned on but still less time & effort than a standard coffee pot. i've been using mine for about a year now & i have no complaints. the one at work demanded a cleaning & all we had to do was run a gallon of vinegar through, no special weird cleaner that you had to special order & wait days for. so easy.
customer_reviews.author: Lori V.

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, works great!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a re-conditioned model and the supplier did a great job (to include replacing the drain that was damaged in transit). I purchased this model based on previous reviews as I was tired of replacing my Kuerig every year. This one seems substantial - time will tell. Has great features, but the kicker for me is that my coffee is actually better tasting! Same coffee pod, but a richer flavor. It may be that the water is hotter, but I can taste the difference. So far a great value!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Moroze

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't get a working one.
customer_reviews.text: The first unit shipped was something totally different, the second arrived with a smashed water tank. After that I gave up. I spent too much time repacking and shipping these units back.
customer_reviews.author: Sebborn

customer_reviews.title: DID NOT WORK OUT OF THE BOX
customer_reviews.text: Took a chance given the substantial discount for refurbished (although this model is discontinued and available new for a discount) and it didn't work right out of the box. Electronic menu cycled through options without stopping. Water pump turned on but never drew water. Not certified by Cuisinart. Too expensive to send back. Amazon allowed me to return and their customer service deserves a high complement.
customer_reviews.author: Jerev

customer_reviews.title: Best. Coffee. Maker. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased my 3rd one--just like this. Before you panic please know there were all for different homes and people. I am cheap so I buy my own ground coffee and use the refillable K-cup that comes with the unit (you can buy one separately for around $17). Here are my fav features of this exact model: Huge water tank=less refilling Built in water filter EASY to read display and buttons--on the other Keurigs, the buttons and displays are on the top and/or the buttons flash a blinding blue so you can't see which one you're supposed to press. This model is early morning friendly--without my contacts or readers!
customer_reviews.author: Karen J. Rinehart

customer_reviews.title: Like everyone else has said
customer_reviews.text: Like everyone else has said, it takes a few seconds longer than a regular Keurig machine to initially heat up... but no big deal, really. Love the big water reservoir - biggest one there is. Someone told me they saw it elsewhere online for half the price, though. So far, it's proving to be a good alternative to the pricey (and poorly-made) Keurig machine - three of which I've gone through with only medium use.
customer_reviews.author: NaplesDoug

customer_reviews.title: Loved it until the design flaw showed up
customer_reviews.text: It developed a leak in the resevoir that could not be stopped..even tried to fix it w a repair kit i found for this design flaw....but it didnt work either....absolutely LOVED it, until it started leaking everywhere and couldn't be fixed. (I later found that this was a common issue with the model, i hope they fix it with newer models!)
customer_reviews.author: S M

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: We've had this a few weeks and do far do good. This replaced our third Kuerig. We didn't want another Kuerig because of the change in pods. The Cuisinart allows you to continue using the original Kuerig pods. Another nice feature is that the water reservoir is larger than the Kuerig and you have five cup sizes. The only downside to this is that the tall latte mugs or to-go cups must be forced under the spout. I worry about chipping my good mugs.
customer_reviews.author: Melaney P. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: So far this has been a great machine. I purchased this after going through 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: So far this has been a great machine. I purchased this after going through 2 Keurig 2.0's in a 3 month period. After reading reviews of the machine, I make sure to use a pitcher to refill the water reservoir which is actually easier than removing the reservoir to refill it so as not to get any air in the water line as others have experienced a problem with. Makes a great cup of coffee! I also like that it has a refillable k cup that can be stored right in the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Kilpack

customer_reviews.title: This is my second unit. We got years out ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second unit. We got years out of the first one with average daily usage. We initially tried another maker Single Serve machine. It was boxed up and returned within 24 hours when no one in the house could fit their travel mugs under it. The replacement Cuisinart couldn't get here fast enough, and has been working flawlessly everyday since. The bottom tray is removable ,allowing ANY size travel mug.
customer_reviews.author: Windy City

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I take coffee to work with me...I have to use coffee mugs to brew a cup because my thermos is too big to fit under the filler...also I have to brew 2 different cups of coffee to get the strength I want...even when buying the strongest blend...takes awhile until the coffee is ready to brew as well...does the job but wish I would have bought a coffee maker that also brews a pot
customer_reviews.author: A. Montalvo

customer_reviews.title: Worked nearly 1 week before water pump died.
customer_reviews.text: Have had my refurbished unit for less than a week and it gave me a nice hot cup of water this morning when I got back from the doctor however it would not give me any water. You can hear it heating up but it will not dispense it, it sounds like another water pump blowout. Very frustrating as this is really a very nice machine and too bad that Cuisinart cannot come up with a better water pump design and fix this obvious problem with their units. Mine is going back, buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: JoAnna K.

customer_reviews.title: So much better than a Keurig!
customer_reviews.text: Kicks a Keurig out of the water. Nice big reservoir, great hot water function for tea and the like. And it just works. Lately every Keurig I bought was a piece of overpriced junk that died within weeks of purchase. Will never buy Keurig again and very happy with this alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Scootir

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome coffee, tea
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome coffee, tea, coco, maker so many choices. This has to be the best made single serve brewer on the market, not only does it look awesome it is well built. I love that the settings allow you to change the cup size and the extra cup for brewing your own bagged coffee or tea is really super. We purchased this about 6 months ago and it is working and looks as beautiful as it did the day we opened the box. The brushed stainless is easy to clean and looks beautiful in the kitchen. We love this coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Campbell Duarte

customer_reviews.title: BEST BREW FOR YOU.
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT - bought to replace my previous one that I used heavily for years ... Thought I would replace it with the new version 2.0 - took it back! Had more restrictions on it than Windows 10 !!! I can see why there are so many hacks for the 2.0 on YouTube ... what a joke! This is the original version ... and the Cuisinart name is one I trust ... Is Factory refurbished but can't tell anything different from the brand new one I bought 3 years ago ... works like a charm. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Catzz

customer_reviews.title: Great features, Bad quality build
customer_reviews.text: I love the features on this coffee machine, but it's the quality that is the problem. My first one lasted almost 60 days. I loved it when it worked. Cuisinart warranty is a joke. They want you to pay for return shipping and also include $10 to cover shipping a replacement. Luckily Amazon has a great return policy. I returned it to Amazon and ordered a replacement once. Received the new one today and hooked it up to brew a cup. Dead on Arrival. I'm not going to get it a 3rd chance. Off to find a new coffee machine.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: This is my third purchase but 1 was a gift. This coffee maker is the best. The pumps have a tendency to quit after some use but my first one took three years to fail - heh, nothing lasts forever. I believe a key to the longevity of the pump is changing the filter regularly. I'm hoping this second one I purchased for are home will be just as good. One of the features I like best is the 80 oz. reservoir.
customer_reviews.author: Swashplate

customer_reviews.title: Pump stopped pumping in 4 months!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this coffee maker for less 4 months. It does not get heavy use. After making 2 cups this morning the pump stopped pumping! I had purchased 2 refurbished ones before getting a new one and BOTH of them were DOA. My 1st one lasted over 2 years. This is the last Cuisinart Keurig coffee maker I will own. If you have $160.00 to throw away buy one!
customer_reviews.author: Adolph-Buddha

customer_reviews.title: why better than a kuerig
customer_reviews.text: We had a Keurig prior to this purchase and before a year was up I was calling Keurig because it stopped working. they would send a replacement ( this happened about 3 times) then finally it lasted more then the year, so we had to purchase a new coffee maker. This has been wonderful. so wonderful we purchased a 2nd one for our camper.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Karl

customer_reviews.title: After 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I bough this Brewer is October 2015 and in April of 2016 is stopped working. I used this machine maybe 4 times a week. So after 6 months it decided to stop working. And I can't returned it since I din't purchase the warranty on it. I would expect a product to last me more that 6 months cosidering the price I payed for this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality machine
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Got for a second home where we often have guests. This way they can make their own, always fresh and hot. I tend to leave brewing size as 6 oz since I like it stronger. Fast recovery between cups and maybe 3-4 minutes to stat, not too bad. Blue light around water reservoir blinks when you need to add more water. In use over 6 months at this point, purchased when there was a rebate so cost was 100. Great value even though the price per cup is not cheap, very handy that guests can get up and help themselves and it's hot and unburnt when brewed.
customer_reviews.author: cityToCountry

customer_reviews.title: Don't make the same mistake I did
customer_reviews.text: I bought this coffeemaker last July, 2015 and while it was refurbished, it was supposed to be at least fit for reasonable use. About 8 months later the coffeemaker failed and had to be discarded. I had previously purchased the identical appliance at retail and in new condition for my office and it continues to work flawlessly almost 2 years later. I strongly recommend against purchasing anything "refurbished" especially from this vendor. I know that I certainly will never make the same mistake again.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J.

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee Pot
customer_reviews.text: I love this more than I loved my Keurig!! Although it's affiliated with Keurig, it's better!! Works exactly the same, takes the same k-cups but my favorite feature is the water reservoir. It holds so much more water!! Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Jacobsen

customer_reviews.title: Just a bad unit?
customer_reviews.text: The unit I purchased was a refab. The 1st time I used it was to do the initial clean out. Thankfully, I was still in the kitchen when I noticed water everywhere on the counter. After cleaning up about a 1/2 pot of water, I checked the underneath side of the unit & could find no reason for the leak. So I tried again, even with an eagle eye, the pot did the same thing. Unfortunately, I had to send it back as damaged.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hiller

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware! Broke after 3.5 months!
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised by all the positive reviews this product has. My guess is that those reviews were written right after purchase. We purchased this Keurig at the end of October and the pump is already broken. It's too late to return through Amazon so we contacted Cuisinart who did not seemed surprised that their product is garbage. They refused to give us a refund. We have to pay to have the replacement shipped to us AND pay to ship their garbage back to them. We'll never buy Cuisinart products again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... this refurbished unit in Jan 2016 and it worked fine for about 2-3 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this refurbished unit in Jan 2016 and it worked fine for about 2-3 months. Then we noticed the amount of coffee pumped into the cups became less and less than what was selected. For example, the 12 oz selection produced about 9 oz near the end of March and now is down to 6 oz (Apr 14). We use filtered water (RO type) religiously in the refill bin. Would not recommend this unit, especially the refurbished ones.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Zedwick

customer_reviews.title: Quality, neat  design and perfect performance!
customer_reviews.text: I was worrying before to order factory refurbished stuff, but when it arrived I was amazed with the quality, neat design and perfect performance! great product for the great price, great company! highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Antonina H.

customer_reviews.title: ... system for 6 months now and could not be happier. Functions great
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this system for 6 months now and could not be happier. Functions great, and we can use generic brands of cups, unlike with the newer Keurig systems that allow for only Keurig-branded cups. I especially like that it comes with a replaceable filter - I think that cuts down on the need to descale the unit. My old Keurig had to be descaled frequently and even then we experienced "short cup" issues early on. So far this machine has had no issues, and is just as easy to use as the Keurig. A great buy!
customer_reviews.author: M. Regan

customer_reviews.title: Terrible service from Amazon Refurbished
customer_reviews.text: Terrible service from Amazon Refurbished, lasted 6 months, so about $10 a month. Done with these "High End" Single Serve Units. Bought a cheapie at a close out store for $15, works perfectly
customer_reviews.author: steven lorik

customer_reviews.title: Its complexity defeats the entire purpose of the keurig system
customer_reviews.text: This thing is absolute garbage. Its complexity defeats the entire purpose of the keurig system. The discoverability of its functions is about as easy as looking for intelligent life on other planets. Its reliability is that of a pinto and it requires more attention in its operation than arming a nuclear warhead. Do yourself a favor and go for the 35-50.00 super-simple featureless keurig brewer. Because thats what is now sitting next to this paperweight. Its bad enough that I am willing to walk a flight of stairs to fill up a coffee cup with water vs rely on this thing and its built in reservoir to get me a good cup of coffee. Complete junk.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Guillette

customer_reviews.title: Buyers beware
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after two and a half months. I would not recommend this product. Tomorrow I will be sending a coffee maker back for A SECOND TIME. The maker is use by only three adults and fewer than six cups per day. It is well cared for. I have never been so disappointed in a Cusinsrt product
customer_reviews.author: Rockland Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great Choice
customer_reviews.text: Love the ease of use. Puts out a great cup of whatever I’m drinking. My only complaint is I can’t really use it for just hot water products like tea or hot chocolate because even after cleaning there’s bound to be some coffee grounds in my drink, which I hate. But that may just be unique to us because we use fresh grounds more than pods so that’s harder to clean.
customer_reviews.author: C. Allen

customer_reviews.title: I'm very satisfied with these Cuisinart single serve coffee makers
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Cuisinart SS. Having owned the first generation up until it died, I'm very satisfied with these Cuisinart single serve coffee makers. Also would like to add that it lasted 4 years. This newer version does not sound like the original. Has an annoying buzz noise but that's our only gripe. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: I am glad I read Consumer Reports first
customer_reviews.text: I had checked Consumer Reports last year before purchasing a single serve coffee machine. This was rated very highly -in in the top three. I have never had a problem of the coffee being not hot enough, and it does brew very quickly. A friend told me their Kuerig machine changed from hot to warm on the brewed coffee. I am glad I read Consumer Reports first.
customer_reviews.author: hjm

customer_reviews.title: Yes!!  You need this!
customer_reviews.text: The first one I got did not work. Sadly.... I messaged them and was sent a replacement immediately and it arrived faster than it was supposed to. The second one works perfectly! I am thrilled to have a working coffee pot and I love this one. It brews ALL pods without a problem unlike some other pots. It's pretty and it's quiet. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Ginger

customer_reviews.title: Yes!
customer_reviews.text: Love this coffee machine! Picked this because the new Keurig's only accept Keurig pods. Nice features including auto-on/off. Gift for hubby but we've both been using it pretty much every day. Was pleasantly surprised to discover it came with the extra insert and washable filter to use your own ground coffee or loose tea.
customer_reviews.author: Meowsers

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for a year and then failed completely. Cuisinarts warranty have you pay for shipping it back to them and shipping a new one to you. Since the machine is around 18lbs that means at least around $50 in shipping costs. Sad!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Better then I expected
customer_reviews.text: This is going to be one of my best reviews of all the products the I buy here in amazon , Cuisinart top name in the kitchen this single coffee machine is the sh.....t sorry but I couldn't put it better keurig reviews are real bad nobody talks anything good about them they look cheap they break and over priced this is a better build machine a little heavy I think thats good 8 to 12 oz coffee brew auto clean and on the side u Have your extra cup to brew your own coffee the price can't beat it so I m just going to say buy it u wont regret it trust me thanks for reading.
customer_reviews.author: Av

customer_reviews.title: 2nd one
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine to replace the one I had bought 2 years ago. My husband & I drink A LOT of coffee. Being in this home is like being in an office of coffee drinkers. We don't use K cups, we use our own coffee in the reusable K cup. We are not easy on a coffeepot. At all. The machine we had prior to the one I bought on the 8th of this month has held up with only minor issues, generally caused by us. After 2 years, the pump started going out. I replaced it with the exact same machine. If you take care of it, it will work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Neubauer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Experience - Two Times
customer_reviews.text: Product was a Refurbished Unit. It arrived Broken in many pieces. Second unit received five days later. Second unit would not work properly. It would make 24 oz cup or a 2 oz cup nothing in between. Than on second day it just would not make anything so sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great Value - Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the programmable feature which turns the system on and pre-heats before I get up and I can also adjust the water temp and default cup size. It came with a few samples of coffee. The donut shop was the best. I ultimately went with San Francisco Bay Coffee pods which not only taste better than any of the others but also MUCH quieter do the the construction of the pod.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Have to unplug a few times to finally get it primed.
customer_reviews.text: Packaged well. Many great usable features! Love being able to dispense hot water almost instantaneously. Huge reservoir for water! It took me about 20 minutes to finally get it primed but once i did it seems to work flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: DXLR8

customer_reviews.title: Great Brewing System
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews and having had some experience with a Keurig I was hesitant to try the Cuisinart but since the price was so good purchased it anyway. I am not at all sorry,faster, large water reservoir, supplied basket for ground coffee and large selection of cup size makes this a great brewing system. I can also use any pod designed to fit and the coffee comes out great. Two months, 200+ brewed cups and no problems makes me a happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love Hate relationship!
customer_reviews.text: I received my 2nd Cuisinart SS 700 recently. The first one just stopped working after 12 months. OK, I figured maybe I got my money's worth and ordered another unit. Well that one lasted only 2 months until it also started brewing 1 ounce of coffee, spitting and then finally stopping altogether. Cusinart, you're not getting me for a 3rd unit and I would encourage anyone interested in buying this unit to NOT. There are as many good reviews as there are bad, and I was one of the good ones when I received my first unit; but the good feeling doesn't last
customer_reviews.author: SFWINO

customer_reviews.title: Unit arrived in like new condition but the unit had to be quickly ...
customer_reviews.text: Unit arrived in like new condition but the unit had to be quickly returned since she was not working. Unit turned on but went to make coffee and it dit not work at all. Unfortunate but at least we tried
customer_reviews.author: Jeff J.

customer_reviews.title: Quality packing
customer_reviews.text: This machine consistently leaks eater all over the counter when brewing and every 4th-5th cup it won't brew at all. It has to be turned off and let cool down. I only drink 2-3 cups a day and am very disappointed. I have cleaned the unit and followed all the trouble shooting problems. I missed the return window while trying to trouble shoot the issues. Not sure I would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: ange

customer_reviews.title: I love this machine
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine. I have one in my kitchen and one in my RV. I was going thru brewing systems every 4-5 months and they would quit. This machine has lasted years. I use only spring water in the machine. Besides lasting it makes a great cup of coffee and I always get the perfect cup of tea!
customer_reviews.author: Paula the Glass Artist

customer_reviews.title: Starts out great and breaks down quickly!
customer_reviews.text: I am on my second Cuisinart. Great while it works! But the second one broke down in EXACTLY the same way as the first one. It started making noise like it was struggling to pump the water. Then, it took 5 minutes to make a cup of coffee and it would only make a half cup. Eventually, it quits altogether. Do not recommend. Got burned twice with the same machine.
customer_reviews.author: melly

customer_reviews.title: Surprised by Height
customer_reviews.text: This unit does what it claims and makes a great cup of coffee or tea. I had hoped to fit it under our kitchen cupboards. The published height is 12.1". Our cabinets have 16" clearance between the cupboards and the counter. I figured No Sweat! This will fit easily! The operating height with the load mechanism open is about 17" so guess what it did not fit where we planned. Oh well! We are enjoying the coffee and tea anyway! See [...]
customer_reviews.author: BULLDG

customer_reviews.title: Happy coffee drinker here.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this machine so far. I love the large water reservoir and sturdy construction. I deducted 1 star because I have had a few cups of coffee with a lot of grounds at the bottom, which never happened with my older Keurig machines. It does take up quite a bit of counter space compared to other single serve Brewers, so probably not ideal for smaller kitchens. Still really like this Cuisinart very much though.
customer_reviews.author: sarbar

customer_reviews.title: Repackaged but not necessarily remanufactured...very bad experience.
customer_reviews.text: Was extremely hard to get working at first. Kept saying descale and not brewing. Then it started working if you ran a rinse cycle first every time you wanted coffee. Then it stopped paying any attention to the cup size and randomly brewed various size cups. Finally a month into it tenure into my house the computer control began to fail and it would go to menu, then go to the lowest setting for each menu line, randomly set an off time....finally it stopped brewing again. Gave up and bought a Keurig brand maker that works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Frank A. Bowdon

customer_reviews.title: PROP  NOT  BREWING  SYSTEM .
customer_reviews.text: The Amazon trust level has been dealt a blow by the REF SS-700 SBS. I HAVE BETTER THINGS TO DO THAN REPACKAGE AND VISIT UPS. The pot was a prop not an real working model . It even came with its own scratches and caused us much TRIAL AND ERROR VEXATION . SHAME ON THE VENDER !
customer_reviews.author: Howard F. Kagen

customer_reviews.title: Love this coffee pot
customer_reviews.text: Love this coffee pot. Gets a 4 star because I had to get a replace due to malfunction of the first one. They replaced free of charge but it cost me $50+ to send defective one to them for them to see what happened to it because it could have started a fire if I wasn't home that day and a response back would have been nice. Now I just unplug before I leave my house. Makes great coffee !!!
customer_reviews.author: Vcombopiano

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely terrible
customer_reviews.text: The coffee maker I received didn't brew a single cup of coffee. It looked new but after I plugged it in it never did anything beyond lighting up. I don't think Cuisinart did anything to refurbish this. They cleaned it up and stuck it in a box without checking to see if it even worked. It's such a shame because this is the second of this model that I've owned and the first one (which I bought brand new) was amazing for the 4 years I had it. Don't waste your time or money on this refurbished model. You'll just end up returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had found this one a year ago!
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace a Keurig that was dying after almost one year of use. Have had it for about a month and is so much quieter than the Keurig ever was. Love that it has the rinse and hot water features. We enjoy tea and hot chocolate as well as coffee. The digital face is easy to read. Nice to come downstairs in the morning and don't have to wait for water to heat up to make coffee with the auto on feature, which has made mornings much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Stacie M Ragan

customer_reviews.title: makes awesome coffee. It's quiet while brewing and has great ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second SS-700 that I am purchasing, only getting the second one because my original finally gave out after 3.5 years. This is a solid machine, makes awesome coffee. It's quiet while brewing and has great accessories if you like to use your own coffee instead of using the Kcups. Recommend this above any of the Keruig makers.
customer_reviews.author: SRose81

customer_reviews.title: I think this is garbage!!
customer_reviews.text: This product was delivered to me Feb. 24,2016. Today is April 1,201ecially6 and it stopped working! I called Cuisinart and they want me to return it, I am to pay postage both ways. I got on the computer with Amazon and I can't return it to them either, cause time has run out for return. I think this is garbage!!!!!!! As expensive as this product is I would expect it to last longer than 6 weeks especially since my husband is the only one who drinks coffee and he only has 1-2 cups every morning. Don't waste your money!!!! .
customer_reviews.author: KMarlene Smith

customer_reviews.title: Mostly like it when it works
customer_reviews.text: Mostly like it when it works. Every now & then it doesn't make a cup of coffee and says to clean, even the day after it arrived. The price was right and I bought the insurance for 3 year extended warranty for $4.99 and have a feeling I may have to use that. Not sure what kind of refurbishing went on since it acts up every now & then for no reason. I put in pre filtered bottled water so no deposits should build up but does say to clean even though newly arrived. Other than never knowing if next cup will pour, I like the style, looks, and convenience.....when it works.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Pump sounds strange
customer_reviews.text: I've had many variants of k-cup brewers over the years. While the water pump is generally loud, the pump on this machine sounds as if it's straining. Called the company and they said it's normal. Previous version of this machine lasted only 2 years (but pump was much quieter).
customer_reviews.author: Michael Militello

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Has never worked correctly since I got it. Whatever size you wanted, say 12 oz it would give you 6 ozs. Did that with every serving size. A week later the filling pump stopped working so I couldn't even get a cup of hot water. I thought Cuisinart was a good product but if this is the garbage they are putting out I will never buy their product again. I don't understand how their quality control didn't see this problem before packing the unit up for shipping. Do not recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Worthless!
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of junk. It requires open and closing the lid several times to get it to (sometimes) start dripping slowly. Stops long before it should and has to be restarted a few times to get a full cup. I can't even return it because the limit for return was 30 days FROM THE DAY I ORDERED IT, giving maybe 3 weeks to try it. Should have sent it back the first week.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Chrisman

customer_reviews.title: ordered from Beach Camera I ordered a product years ago and remembered the item looked and ran like New, the cuisinart was in th
customer_reviews.text: Research the company first, but didn't have to in my case, ordered from Beach Camera I ordered a product years ago and remembered the item looked and ran like New, the cuisinart was in the original box everything taped and wrapped like I just got it New, runs perfect, so far so good
customer_reviews.author: John T. Kesil

customer_reviews.title: Buy a Cuisinart SS-700 but not a refurbished one
customer_reviews.text: I have one of these coffee makers at home and I love it. I purchases this on for our office as a backup in case our coffee make took a dump. When we attempted to use it, it says descale. We descale and it works for a few days then it says descale again. I would recommend the Cuisinart SS-700 but I would not recommend buying it refurbished.
customer_reviews.author: Janette Horton

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my Cuisinart back in November 2015 and it is still working. I absolutely love this machine and recommend it. My coffee never tastes watered down like the "K" brand out there. You can pick several settings for coffee cup size, water temperature, and you can also just get hot water for teas or soups. You also have the option of using your own favorite coffee brand without having to buy the KCups since it comes with its own reusable pod.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.F

customer_reviews.title: Great Item!! Versatile and Working great!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely no problems so far. Works great. Upon turning on, initial warm-up takes 30-60 seconds. BUT, you can set a 'Wake Up' time on unit so you don't have to wait for warm-up (my erratic schedule doesn't allow for this feature without leaving on for a 1-2 hr period). To dispense 14 oz cup it takes less than 30 seconds. Can select: Cup Size, Coffee Temp, Hot Water Dispense, Rinse with Hot Water. Dont always need to buy K-Cups. Unit comes with a re-usable plastic "K-Cup" apparatus for individual preference of coffee or tea. Also, the plastic K-Cup stores in convenient compartment on side of the unit so you wont loose items... VERY HAPPY AND VERY GOOD MACHINE!
customer_reviews.author: Roopinder

customer_reviews.title: We took good care of it always following manufactures instructions
customer_reviews.text: We had our Cusinart SS-700 less than a year when it quit working. No further descaling needed. We took good care of it always following manufactures instructions. Now purchased regular Kerig unit hoping for better outcome. Can see why this has been discontinued. Took a paper clip as described by another reviewer and cleared pins. Now may be working.. Fingers crossed. Why if descale and follow directions as given by manufacturer did this occur???
customer_reviews.author: Dot

customer_reviews.title: Highly Addictive
customer_reviews.text: This handsome system is very easy to use, much tidier and takes up less space than my old coffee-maker. Have not brewed a bad cup of coffee, yet; very handy for a quick spot of tea, hot chocolate or instant soup cup. I leave the water reservoir in place after having read a review that indicated removing it can allow air in the lines and cause issues. Access lid makes it easy enough to replace a cupful of water after each brew. Brewing just one cup makes the house smell welcoming and wonderful--like a bistro.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wyman

customer_reviews.title: So far - only a couple weeks into it, I love it way more than my Keurig B-70
customer_reviews.text: My Keurig started leaking and ultimately just quit working. I had read some older reviews on the SS-700 saying that it used the same part and had the same problem, but the most recent one I could find was dated in late 2010. So, I am hoping that proper modifications have been made to solve any leakage problems. This machine has an 80 oz reservoir which is FANTASTIC and it is whisper quiet. My Keurig wasn't this quiet when it was brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Riley's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Like new refurbished brewer.
customer_reviews.text: Great coffee machine. Ten times better than the new model that replaced it.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Better than Keurig
customer_reviews.text: So much better than the ever popular Keurig. I did a lot of research before buying a single serve machine. The Cuisinart ss-700 was among reviewers top 3 picks out of many single servers. I now know why. Easy set up, Easy clean up, Not plastic or cheap, No splatter, No watered down coffee taste, Freedom to use whatever k cups you want... Definitely would recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Roxyrulz

customer_reviews.title: so far i love it i am using it mostly with the my ...
customer_reviews.text: so far i love it i am using it mostly with the my k-cup reusable filter basket. i use 2 1/2 scoops and gently tap it down on the counter and 12 oz's water. i Am grinding beans at the store on the finer side of the auto drip setting and am getting a good strong cup with great flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Blabadoo

customer_reviews.title: Even Better Version
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Cuisnart SS-700. We had our previous model for over two years. My wife and I both work from home, so this is a product that gets used all the time. So we were happy to buy a second one. We have noticed some subtle changes -- probably the biggest is an water advancing pump. Which sounds like it's refilling the chamber before brewing. It makes some sound, but it makes it that much more effective in it's brewing process. If you bought this product early on and had some problems early, and are considering jumping back in, I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Welton

customer_reviews.title: Well Designed Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with this coffee maker. It's well designed and built sturdy. I like the rinse button which is nice for transitioning between flavored coffees or just to quickly clean the lines at any time. I also like the feature to dispense hot water for making a cup coco, tea,,or oatmeal. For making coffee, it's easy to program ahead, making different size cups is a snap also. The front lift is made of metal which feels substantial. The water reservoir is Hugh which minimizes constant refills. Makes a good cup of coffee - better than my previous machine (Kierig).
customer_reviews.author: David M Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: I guess it gets one star because it technically has power to the unit. This machine is supposedly "certified refurbished" but it simply did not work. I could see areas where dings and scratches were painted over, which would not be a problem for me if the thing ACTUALLY worked.
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy renewed
customer_reviews.text: First time to buy a “renewed” product...... NEVER AGAIN!!! Didn’t work out of the box.... PIA to return..... only bought it because I loved my SS-700 and read the reviews of the SS-10.....
customer_reviews.author: Diane M Schoonhoven

product_meta.title: Cuisinart SS-700 Single Serve Brewing System, Silver DISCONTINUED BY MANUFACTURER
product_meta.description: Style:DiscontinuedThe Cuisinart SS-700 Single-Serve Brewing System Perfect for both personal use and entertaining, this single-serve home-brewing system offers consumers fresh gourmet coffee, tea, hot cocoa and more in under one minute. Choose either 4, 6, 8, or 10 ounce from the icon on brewing size options. Using Keurig K-Cups & mdash; featuring over two hundred varieties of pre-measured, premium brand coffee and tea--this brewer’s innovative one-touch technology makes it easier than ever for consumers to enjoy a wide array of hot beverages. No matter which cup size you choose, the Cuisinart Single Serve Brewing System, working in conjunction with K-Cup, always produces the perfect cup every time. Using Your SS-700 Single-Server Brewing System The control panel will display OPEN HEAD while in idle mode. Place a cup or mug on the drip tray: the drip tray can be removed to accommodate travel mugs. Lift the handle. The brewing chamber will open toward you. Select a K-Cup Portion Pack (Do not remove the foil lid or puncture the K-Cup) Place the K-Cup in the brewing chamber. Lower the handle to close the brewing chamber. When closed completely, the control panel will indicate READY. All brew size icons will be displayed with the default size shown as a solid mug. To choose a different size use the up or the down button. Choose from 4, 6, 8, or 10 ounce brew sizes. Once a size is chosen, press Brew. Only the Brew button will be lit. The control panel will now display BREWING, as well as the serving size you selected. To use the iced beverage setting, place a tall glass filed with ice on the drip tray. Use your favorite K-Cup, select the iced beverage brew size (4 ounces) and press the brew button. Once brewing is complete, add more ice. Add cream and sugar if desired. One-Touch Control Panel Hot Water/Rinse Your brewer is equipped to dispense hot water to make hot chocolate, tea, soup and more. Your brewer is also equipped with a rinse cycle to flush out residual flavors. The rinse cycle will dispense about 4 ounces of hot water. To Rinse: Place a cup or mug on the drip tray. Lift the handle. The brewing chamber will open towards you; check to make sure there is no K-Cup inserted. Lower the handle to close the brewing chambers. When closed completely, the control panel will indicated READY. Press Rinse. During the rinse cycle, only the RINSE button will be lit. The control panel will display the word RINSE. Following the Rinse cycle, your brewer will automatically fill and heat in preparation for the next cycle. Once the heat cycle is completed, the RINSE and HOT WATER buttons will remain lit for one minute. While the buttons are lit, you can perform another rinse cycle or dispense hot water without opening the brew chamber. To Make Hot Water: Place a cup or mug on the drip tray. If you’ve just completed a rinse or hot water cycle proceed to step 4. Lift the handle. The brewing chamber will open towards you; check to make sure there is no K-Cup inserted. Lower the handle to close the brewing chamber. When closed completely, the control panel will indicate READY. All brew-size icons will be displayed with your default size shown as a solid mug. To choose a different size use the up or the down button. Press Hot Water. While the hot water cycle is in progress, only the hot water button will be lit. The control panel will display the words HOT WATER, as well as the serving size you selected. Following the cycle, your brewer will automatically fill and heat in preparation for the next cycle. After the heating cycle is completed, you can perform a rinse or another hot water cycle immediately for up to one minute. The RINSE and HOT WATER buttons will be lit. After this time the unit will return to idle mode and OPEN HEAD will be displayed. Brewing with the My K-Cup Reusable Coffee Filter The Cuisinart Single Serve Brewing System comes with a My K-Cup reusable coffee filter, which allows you to use your own ground coffee. The dishwasher safe, My K-Cup conveniently stores in the easy-open compartment. Open the storage compartment located on the right side of the brewer by pressing the finger indent. Disassemble the My K-Cup by turning the lid from the holder in a counter-clockwise direction. Remove the filter basket from the holder. Wash the My K-Cup lid, filter basket and holder in warm soapy water prior to use, making sure to rinse and dry thoroughly. All My K-Cup parts are dishwasher safe. Insert the filter basket into the holder. Fill the filter basket with ground coffee making sure not to fill past the top of the mesh. Adjust the amount to your personal preference. Do not tamp the grinds. Ensure there are no grinds remaining on the upper rim of the filter basket. Turn clock-wise to seal. Raise the handle and the brew chamber will open toward you. Remove the K-Cup holder from the brewing chamber by pulling toward you. Drop the assembled My K-Cup into the brewing chamber. Follow the brewing instructions . Following the brewing raise the handle and remove the K-Cup. Disassemble the My K-Cup by turning the lid from the holder in a counter-clockwise direction. Remove the filter basket from the holder, discard the grounds and rinse out the filter basket. Replace the K-Cup holder, ensuring the arrow on K-Cup rim aligns with the arrow on the brewing chamber. Gently push the K-Cup holder to snap into place. Special Programmable Features The brewer provides three ways for you to enjoy gourmet coffee, tea of hot cocoa on your own schedule. It will take the brewer approximately 3-1/2 minutes to warm up from room temperature. Leave it on all the time: The brewer can be left on all the time so that is it always ready to brew a fresh cup of gourmet coffee, tea or hot cocoa. To turn the brewer off at any time, simply press the power switch located on the right side of the brewer. Set the Brewer to AUTO OFF: This will automatically shut the brewer off after a specified period of time from the last brew. Program your Brewer for a specific ON and/or OFF TIME: By programming your brewer to turn on each morning, you will never have to wait for the brewer to warm up in order to brew a gourmet cup of coffee. Programming Brew Temperature: The brewer brews at a pre-set temperature of 192°F. If you prefer a cooler cup of coffee, hot water, tea, or cocoa, you may adjust this temperature down by 5 degrees. .
feature_bullets: Large 80-ounce removable water reservoir eliminates the need for frequent refills
5 cup sizes, including iced beverage setting and removable drip tray for tall travel mugs
Fully programmable blue backlit LCD with digital clock, auto on/off and adjustable temperature
Includes: My K-Cup Reusable Coffee Filter, charcoal water filter, 12 K-Cup Portion Pack and instruction book
Product Built to North American Electrical Standards

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars2,586 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
